js
Interface Cases

public interface Cases

An opaque interface helping to simulate JavaScript switch statement in the Java language environment.

This interface must be implemented in JS Simulation Libraries.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
Js.cases()
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. Re-compilers shall convert Java switch statements like: 
switch (Js.cases().add(k0).add(k1).add(k2).indexOf(k)) {
  case 0:
    statement0;

  case 1:

    statement1;

  case 2:

    statement2;

  default:

    default_statement;

}
into JavaScript switch statements as: 
switch (k) {
  case k0:
    statement0;

  case k1:

    statement1;

  case k2:

    statement2;

  default:

    default_statement;

}

Method Summary
 Cases add(java.lang.Object key)
          Adds a key to the current Cases cache.
 int indexOf(java.lang.Object key)
          Returns the index of a key by searching its reference in the current Cases cache.
 

Method Detail

add

Cases add(java.lang.Object key)

Adds a key to the current Cases cache.

Returns:
The current Cases cache itself.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must append the expression of key to the current re-compile time Cases cache without generating any JavaScript statements or expressions for the interface invocation of this method.

indexOf

int indexOf(java.lang.Object key)

Returns the index of a key by searching its reference in the current Cases cache.

Returns:
The index of a key in the current Cases cache.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must find the identifier of key by looking into the current re-compile time Cases cache reporting error if it can not and replace the interface invocation of this method with the key identifier it has found.
